agiletrack.swing

Class JCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • agiletrack.swing.JCalendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class JCalendar
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class renders and provides some UI interaction for a single calendar month. When rendered, it stretches to fit the area the component must occupy. It provides action events for clicks and cell changes. It is intended to be used in more complex components to provide date selection, or presentation capability.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JCalendar.BasicDate
      This class reduced Java's Date class into a simpler format for comparison purposes I effectively strips time out of the date and compares the simple text representation, but can return a Date object if necessary.

    • Method Detail

      • setUsesRolloverHighlight

        public void setUsesRolloverHighlight(boolean useRolloverHighlight)
        Toggle whether or to highlight the date when the mouse rolls over it.
        Parameters:
        useRolloverHighlight - if true, rollover highlighting is enabled.

      • getDate

        public java.util.Date getDate(int dateX,
                     int dateY)
        Find the date value for the given X, Y coordinates relative to the top-left corner of the calendar. Used to find which cell the mouse is over.
        Parameters:
        dateX - the x coordinate used in the lookup
        dateY - the y coordinate used in the lookup
        Returns:
        the date of the cell intersected by the X, Y coordinates

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paint the JCalendar. Without the paint method, the component is pretty much nothing. Labels days of the week, weeks of the year, and days of the month. Also paints special highlight colors in date cells.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object used for painting.

      • addActionListener

        public final void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Add an action listener. The JCalendar provides ActionEvents for clicks as well as for moving the mouse between date cells.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object

      • removeActionListener

        public final void removeActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Remove an action listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object

      • fireActionPerformed

        private final void fireActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)

      • setCalendarView

        public void setCalendarView(java.util.Date date)
        Set the date which determines the month and year rendered by the calendar view. The JCalendar object will use the month and year contained in the Date object.
        Parameters:
        date - the date used to set the month and year

      • getCalendarView

        public java.util.Date getCalendarView()
        Get a date which corresponds with the currently viewed month on the JCalendar. The date will be the beginning of the first day of the viewed month and year.
        Returns:
        a date representing the currently viewed month in the calendar

      • setDateHighlight

        public void setDateHighlight(java.util.Date date,
                    java.awt.Color color)
        Provide a special highlight color for a particular date on the Calendar. The color provided will be used to colorize the particular day on the JCalendar with a custom color.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to be highlighted
        color - the color to be used in highlighting the date cell

      • getDateHighlight

        public java.awt.Color getDateHighlight(java.util.Date date)
        Get the highlight color for a particular date if there is one. This will always return null until some highlights have been set for specific dates.
        Parameters:
        date - the date for which the highlight color is desired
        Returns:
        the color used to highlight the specified date

      • clearDateHighlights

        public void clearDateHighlights()
        Resets the highlights in the JCalendar so that no dates are highlighted.

      • getCursorDate

        public java.util.Date getCursorDate()
        Get the date over which the mouse cursor is positioned or was at the beginning of a click.
        Returns:
        the date that the mouse is over
